data.title: Can't Rate Food Because We Were Totally Ignored
data.text: Stopped in here on a Friday night. Sat ourselves at a booth and waited, and waited, and waited, and waited.  Tried to catch the attention of a server to no avail.  Debated whether to get up and approach a server. By then too mad to enjoy anything so we left. End of story, and this review.

data.title: Cool atmosphere, good food
data.text: Great pub food, good value. I would come back here again. The only thing is they should have more drink specials on spirits.

data.title: Bartenders Rock but otherwise bad times
data.text: Bartenders (especially outside) were great and helpful.  But the inside staff treated us as though we were a bother.  and things on posters inside were outside and vice versa.  Very confusing.

data.title: Will not be back.
data.text: I had tried this place 2 years ago and was not impressed with the food. Decided to give it another try for a few beers and an appetizer.  Stopped in on a Sunday at 5:00 and we were the only customers.  Sat at the bar and ordered beers and the nachos.  Had to ask for a coaster as my beer was sweating all over the bar. Not a big deal but since we are the only customers would have expected at least coasters with our drinks.  The nachos came with barely warm nacho sauce with a handful of black beans, corn and jalapenos with a blob of sour cream. It was supposed to come with a side of ranchero sauce which we didn't get.  We sat at the bar and the server didn't return until we were ready to go so didn't get a chance to ask for it. The nachos were not good, the service was not good and the atmosphere was not good.  Cool can nacho sauce is not good eats to me along with lack of attention from the bartender to see if our food was ok. If a restaurant is empty at dinnertime that means something.

data.title: Great food and selection of adult beverage.
data.text:
Great selection of beers and other spirits.  Nice size seating area inside with a nice outside seating area as well.  Their food is really tasty and service is great.
The only thing that was distasteful was the horrible smell in the Mens Room, I mean it was so so bad you would want to puck.  They either need to check the pipes or put a whole lot of Odor Eliminators in there spraying the restroom consistently along with some big exhaust fans.

Other than that it's a great place to go.

data.title: Best shrimp tacos in town
data.text: They have the best shrimp tacos and pulled pork nachos. You have to try them. Food takes too long but it's worth the wait. Although the beer garden it's great it's always empty. Prices are kind of high and I feel that is why.

data.title: Go here for Brisket!
data.text: We have returned to this restaurant several times because the Brisket is soooo good! The atmosphere is average, its not the reason you visit. Lots of tv's so you can follow whichever current sporting event is in season.

data.title: Nice outdoor garden area
data.text: I enjoyed the shrimp po boy with cilantro truffle fries and great service from Blair. Reasonably priced  and the best fries

data.title: Great service and good steak sandwich
data.text: The bartenders 1st day very friendly and quick service and good steak sandwich.  Cold been never hurts also, I was early so it had not picked up yet.  Looked like people were getting ready for a Black Hawks crowd.

data.title: Good atmosphere
data.text: WE liked going here with our daughter. Good drinks and food. The service could be better as the bartender was our server..

data.title: Great food, nice atmosphere
data.text: We go here after softball on a regular basis. There food is always good and the beer garden is very nice. Love the cajun chicken penne pasta and the burgers. Definitely get the cilantro truffle fries.

data.title: This place has gone downhill
data.text:
I would like to start by saying that even though I rated this low and it would seem that I am a "hater" I actually would like this place to be successful.

First of, the positives:
a) The place still has the nostalgia of when Prairie rock used to mean something special in Elgin.
b) The beer garden is still my favorite
c) Since no one really comes here like before, good seating is not a problem
d) They implemented karaoke and that's a good time

The Bad:
a) Service is horrible. You have to wait a long time to ask if you want a beer, even though no one is at the bar. There is one gentleman at the bar who is on top of things. He remembers people's names and is friendly. It would be nice to see more of that.

b)Beer Selection. Although they have a few good craft beers, bring more in. The owner once said that people don't buy the craft beer. His competition, The Walnut Room" is saturated with craft beer. I guess that's why the competition is always packed. Get more CRAFT BEER!!

c) I know you serve bar food, but it doesn't have to taste like bar food. Come on! Have respect for your establishment. Try bringing in a true chef! One can only take your hamburguesses for so long!

The Bad:
The owner, an older gentleman, sees me in all the time, yet never once makes an effort to welcome me to his establishment, even though I have disposable income and spend $50 or more at this place. The one time he talked to me, I was with a friend and the statements that came out of this guy's mouth about other kinds of people. This guy might not like some people, but will gladly take their money.

data.title: Good food, cool place - order cilantro truffle fries
data.text: Cool, local place in an old building.  Food is good and pretty diverse beer list.  Sweet potato criss-cut fries and cilanto truffle fries are delish.

data.title: Nice Bar and Grill
data.text: Excellent BBQ and sandwiches and an awesome fish fry.  Nice outdoor patio and they aim to please. When in Elgin eat here instead of at the over-rated Grand Victoria Casino.

data.title: Great place for casual dining
data.text: The BEST beef brisket and pulled pork sandwiches ever....great home made coleslaw! Always consistently good. Great selection of draft beers....including two brothers and Payton's new brew.
